q:
You have three processes, Process 1, Process 2, and Process 3 that contains three assigned resources, Resource 1, Resource 2, and Resource 3 respectively. You observed that one resource is assigned to one process and the same process is waiting for the other resource as represented in the provided diagram. If you have implemented the resource preemption technique to recover this deadlock, then what are the disadvantages of using this technique?

Diagram

Disadvantage

  1. Neither of the processes nor the resources can be selected for the preemption as no order of processes is defined to utilize the resources to minimize the cost.
  2. A frequent rollback from the resource to the process allows an incomplete preemption.
  3. There is no assurance that the resources are preempted from the same process.

In an operating system, consider the set of four active processes P1, P2, P3, and P4. and the semaphore ‘S’ has an initial value of 2. If the events take place in the following order, then how many processes will be unlocked:

P1 : P(S) P2 : P(S) P3 : P(S) P4 : P(S) P5 : V(S)

If there are two processes ‘A’ and ‘B’ and variables ‘mutex_a’ and ‘mutex_b’ initialized to 1, then what will you replace Statement_1, Statement_2, Statement_3, and Statement_4 with to avoid a deadlock:

A: B:
while(true)
{
Statement_1;
Statement_2;
/*Critical section*/
signal(mutex_a);
signal(mutex_b);
}		 while(true)
{
wait(mutex_a);
wait(mutex_b);
/*Critical section*/
Statement_3;
Statement_4;
}

If there are two processes ‘P’ and ‘Q’ and a variable ‘mutex’ is initialized to 1, then what is the regular expression generated by the following processes:

P: Q:
while(true)
{
wait(mutex);
print(“a”)
signal(mutex);
}		 while(true)
{
wait(mutex);
print(“b”);
signal(mutex);
}

In an operating system, consider that a process P1 has been allocated a non-shareable resource A and process P2 has also been allocated a non-shareable resource B. Process P1 needs resource B to proceed and process P2 needs resource A to proceed. If these are only two processes in the system, then each process is blocked by the other causing the system to halt. Which of these terms best describes this situation?

In an operating system, consider three processes, P1, P2, and P3 competing for a non-sharable resource R. P1 is first granted access to R. Then when P1 exits its critical section, R is allocated to P3 and P1 requires access to R again. If the operating system alternately allocates R to P1 and P3, then P2 has to wait indefinitely. Which of the following terms best describes this problem?
Which of the following statements about deadlock recovery is true?

a.option: The detection algorithm has to be invoked after terminating every process
The process is roll backed to a safe state to restart later
One or more processes involved in the deadlock could be terminated to break the deadlock

q:
In an operating system, consider the following snapshot of the system, where R0, R1, R2, and R3 are the resources and P0, P1, P2, and P3 are the processes. Which of the following is not a safe state sequence?

Allocation
  R0 R1 R2 R3
P0 0 0 1 2
P1 1 0 0 0
P2 1 3 5 4
P3 0 6 3 2
Max
  R0 R1 R2 R3
P0 0 0 1 2
P1 1 7 5 0
P2 2 3 5 6
P3 0 6 5 2
Available
  R0 R1 R2 R3
P0 1 5 2 0
